subject: RE: [junit] ANN: test your JUnit 3.8/4.0 skills
msgSnippet: I don t know anything about javablackbelt.com, but I hope you re not going to charge anyone money to take that test as it s currently written!  It tests
messageBody:
I don't know anything about javablackbelt.com, but I
hope you're not going to charge anyone money to take
that test as it's currently written! It tests knowledge
of things that aren't JUnit, inadequately tests things
are ARE JUnit, and considers opinions as facts. Plus,
many of the questions are posed in such weak English
that they are ambiguous and confusing. Or maybe to be
a "Java Black Belt" you must surpass such trivia.


Todd.




> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of jeanneboyarsky
> Sent: Sunday, March 12, 2006 12:52 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] ANN: test your JUnit 3.8/4.0 skills
>
> JavaBlackBelt announces two new exams on JUnit:
>
> You can take a free exam on JUnit
> 3.8
> (http://javablackbelt.com/jbb/QuestionnaireDefDisplay.do?quest
> publicId=00148)
> or JUnit 4.0
> (http://javablackbelt.com/jbb/QuestionnaireDefDisplay.do;11421
> 92192231?questpublicId=00118.)
>
>
> The JUnit 3.8 exam tests your basic JUnit knowledge. It can
> count towards a Java belt.
>
> The JUnit 4.0 covers the new/different features in JUnit 4.0.
> You can take it as often as you like, so it is a good way to
> practice/review JUnit 4.0.
>
>
>
>
